enWisdom: Lustful desires are lethal
Lust is spoliation [of intellect and faith]
Lustful desires are the snares of Satan
Lust is the most harmful of enemies
Lustful desires are lethal poisons
Yielding to lust is the worst disease
Lust is one of the two causes of deviation

Wisdom: الشَّهَوَاتُ أَعْلَالٌ قَاتِلَاتٌ وَأَفْضَلُ دَوَائِهَا اقْتِنَاءُ الصَّبْرِ عَنْهَا
enWisdom: Lustful desires are fatal illnesses, and the best cure for them is acquiring patience against them
Lustful desires are the snares of Satan
Overcome [your] lust, [and] your wisdom will be perfected
Protect your stomach and your private parts from what is forbidden
The beginning of lust is pleasure and its end is harm
Being overpowered by lust is the cause of evil

Wisdom: لَنْ يَهْلِكَ الْعَبْدُ حَتَّى يُؤْثِرَ شَهْوَتَهُ عَلَى دِينِهِ
enWisdom: A servant will never be destroyed until he prefers his lust over his religion

Wisdom: مَنْ غَلَبَ عَلَيْهِ غَضَبُهُ وَشَهْوَتُهُ فَهُوَ فِي [مِنْ‏] حَيِّزِ الْبَهَائِمِ
enWisdom: One whose anger overpowers him is susceptible to its harm

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَمْلِكْ شَهْوَتَهُ لَمْ يَمْلِكْ عَقْلَهُ
enWisdom: One who does not control his lust does not control his intellect

Wisdom: مَا شَيْ‏ءٌ مِنْ مَعْصِيَةِ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ يَأْتِي إِلَّا فِي شَهْوَةٍ
enWisdom: Constant sinning cuts [one’s] sustenance
There is no trial [and temptation] greater than lust
There is no pleasure in transient desires

Wisdom: مَا أَحْسَنَ بِالْإِنْسَانِ أَنْ لَا يَشْتَهِيَ مَا لَا يَنْبَغِي
enWisdom: How good it would be for people not to desire that which they ought not to [crave for]
